descripcion:
Take your career to new heights with Loopio! üöÄ‚ú®

Loopio is a workplace that unleashes learning & growth opportunities for our Loopers. We provide autonomous, challenging work that allows each employee to master their craft. We attract and retain people who are naturally curious, have grit and are eager to grow and build their careers. At Loopio, we genuinely support each other, because true success comes from working as #oneteam.

We are looking for an experienced Senior-level Cloud Engineer to build and support all the aspects of our platform infrastructure. You will be joining the team of talented Engineers and Architects on the mission to support and enable our software development and machine learning/data teams to deliver cutting-edge features to our customers with high speed and confidence in an automated and repeatable process.

Our infrastructure is in constant evolution, leveraging the latest Cloud technology; compute, serverless, database, caching, deployments, and security. If you are a passionate engineer who always looks at opportunities to improve your mastery and enjoys working in a fast-paced collaborative environment, you will be successful in this role.

This role requires close collaboration with teams across Canada, the UK, and India. To accommodate the time zone differences, you will be expected to work from 11 am to 7:30 pm IST.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

  • Building, maintaining, scaling, and hardening AWS infrastructure that supports current and future needs of our platform

  • Maintain and improve the security posture of Loopio‚Äôs infrastructure in order to protect customer data

  • Collaborate closely with InfoSec, Architect and Engineering teams to find the best solution for services on the AWS platform

  • Automating manual tasks, allowing the team to continue to focus on moving forward: improving our security posture, evaluating new technologies, and helping launch exciting new features

  • Participate in strategic platform and technology decisions, including new technologies, cost-savings strategies, and improved process

  • Project based work including software upgrades, centralized logging, automated monitoring, automated configuration management, load testing, exploring alternative tools to incorporate into the environment, etc.

  • Mentor and coach others, providing technical guidance and helping build an environment of knowledge-sharing and candid feedback

  • Playing a supporting role by joining Incident Response and on-call rotations

  • Improve both our incident response by simulating failure scenarios, and disaster recovery processes

What You‚Äôll Bring to the Team

  • 5+ years of experience in a high-growth agile software development environment

  • A focus on automation and reducing toil

  • Leadership within the team, expressing candor & curiosity

  • Ability to operate independently and collaborate effectively across Engineering teams as well as cross-functionally towards achieving the same goal¬†

  • Experience with AWS and AWS services (EC2, RDS, Route 53, VPCs, etc) and Azure

  • Strong understanding of Immutable Infrastructure and Infrastructure as Code (Terraform)

  • Experience with monitoring tools (CloudWatch, Datadog, etc.)

  • Solid understanding of best practices for delivery of cloud-based managed applications at a global scale (e.g. DevOps, SRE, continuous delivery).

  • Experience with containerization technology (Docker, ECS, Fargate)

  • Passionate about continuous improvement and promoting a culture of feedback driven by data and key metrics.

  • Experience building and supporting high-performance / high-availability platforms with a microservices architecture

  • Experience with Jenkins (CI/CD pipelines)

  • Experience with centralized configuration management tools, such as Chef and Ansible

Why You‚Äôll ‚ù§Ô∏è Working at Loopio

  • Loopio is a remote-first workplace because we recognize the advantages of working flexibly. We are HQ‚Äôd in Canada, with established hub regions around the world where we hire from.¬†

  • Our employees (or Loopers, as we call ourselves!) live and work in üá®üá¶ Canada (British Columbia and Ontario), üá¨üáß London, and üáÆüá≥ India (specifically in Gujarat, Maharashtra, and Bengaluru).

  • Our India/UK hub employees work according to business hours stated in the job description above. This is intentionally designed to enable our global teams to have overlapping hours for collaboration.

  • You‚Äôll collaborate with your teams virtually across the UK, India, and North America (we‚Äôre just a Zoom call and Slack message away!) with core sync hours and focus time for headsdown work üôáüèæ during the workday

  • We encourage asynchronous collaboration to effectively work as a global #OneTeam!

Why You‚Äôll ‚ù§Ô∏è Working at Loopio

  • Your manager supports your development by providing ongoing feedback and regular 1-on-1s, we leverage Lattice for our 1:1s and performance conversations¬†¬†

  • You will have the opportunity to elevate ü™Ñ your craft and the opportunity to explore your creativity, with a dedicated professional mastery allowance for more learning support! We encourage experimentation and innovative thinking to drive business impact.

  • We offer a wide range of health and wellness benefits to support your physical and mental well-being, starting day 1Ô∏è‚É£ with Loopio.

  • We‚Äôll set you up to work remotely with a MacBook laptop üçè, a monthly phone and internet subsidy, and a work-from-home budget to help get your home office all set up.¬†¬†

  • You‚Äôll be joining a supportive culture that has thoughtfully built out opportunities for connections in a remote first environment.

  • Participate in üé§ townhalls, AMA (Ask-Me-Anything), and quarterly celebrations to celebrate the big wins and milestones as #oneteam!

  • Our four active Employee Resource Groups offer opportunities for employees to learn and connect year-round.¬†

  • You‚Äôll be a part of an award-winning workplace üèÜwith an opportunity to make a big impact on the business.

Questioning your qualifications? Read this ‚ÄºÔ∏è Hi there, we recognize that all too often, potential candidates don‚Äôt apply for a position simply because they don‚Äôt hit every single criteria included in the job description‚Äîparticularly members of underrepresented groups.¬†

Whether or not your experience ‚úÖ checks off all the boxes on a job posting, we still encourage you to apply to ensure that your application receives a review from our team. We understand that a resume can only showcase so much during the applicant stage, so we've created prompts in the application for you to share more about yourself. If you've made a career transition (or a few!), you‚Äôre self taught in a new role, or you have skills/experience you‚Äôd like to highlight, we want to hear more about what you could bring to the table.

AI in Recruitment üë©üèª‚Äçüíª At Loopio, we leverage¬† artificial intelligence (AI) technology to enhance our recruitment process. These tools assist with tasks such as resume screening, drafting preliminary job descriptions, generating initial interview questions, and occasionally sourcing prospective candidates. However, AI is never used to make final hiring decisions; our use of AI¬† serves to support repetitive and administrative tasks in order to streamline our hiring and recruitment workflows. We are committed to the responsible use of AI in our hiring practices, prioritizing both¬† an improved candidate experience and operational efficiency. Our standardized hiring practices remain focused on reducing biases, with all key hiring decisions¬† solely made by our team. We continuously review and refine our hiring practices to align with¬† industry best practices and evolving legal guidelines

Loopio is an equal opportunity employer that is deeply committed to building equitable workplaces that are diverse and inclusive. We actively encourage candidates from all backgrounds and lifestyles to consider us as a future employer. Please contact a member of our Talent Experience team (work@loopio.com) should you require accommodations at any point during our virtual interview processes.
tecnologias: Go, R, Express, AWS, Azure, Docker, Jenkins, Terraform, Ansible, Machine Learning, AI, DevOps, CI/CD, Agile, Microservices, API

descripcion:
Company Description

Big challenges need bold thinkers.

If you‚Äôre someone who sees problems as opportunities, you‚Äôll thrive here.¬†RESPEC is 100% employee-owned, which means we take ownership of every challenge. Here, your ideas drive real solutions. Since 1969, we‚Äôve tackled complex challenges in energy transition, infrastructure resilience, digital transformation, and sustainability.

At RESPEC, you‚Äôll work alongside clients to take on critical problems. Depending on your expertise, you might design infrastructure in remote locations, develop renewable energy solutions for global projects, or apply data-driven technology to improve mining and water systems.

We bring deep technical knowledge, real-world experience, and a commitment to work that matters. If you're looking for a place where your contributions have real impact, you‚Äôll fit right in.

We do not accept unsolicited resumes from third-party recruiters.



    Job Description

    RESPEC is seeking a part-time contract AIX Developer to support key federal IT clients. This role involves maintaining and enhancing AIX-based systems in a secure, regulated environment. Ideal for experienced professionals looking to contribute on a flexible, part-time basis. U.S. Citizenship and ability to obtain a Public Trust clearance are required.

    Responsibilities:

    • Design and implement scripts, utilities, and applications on AIX platforms.
    • Administer AIX systems: installation, patching, performance tuning, and monitoring.
    • Create and maintain automation scripts (Shell, Python, Perl) to reduce manual tasks.
    • Troubleshoot complex issues in AIX environments and perform root cause analysis.
    • Ensure system security in compliance with HIPAA, NIST, and federal standards.
    • Collaborate in Agile/DevOps teams and clearly communicate technical solutions.


    Qualifications

    Qualifications:

    • 3+ years of hands-on AIX system administration or development experience (AIX 7.x).
    • Proficiency in shell scripting (Korn/Bash) and at least one additional scripting language.
    • Strong knowledge of AIX internals: LVM, JFS2, networking, and system processes.
    • Demonstrated problem-solving and troubleshooting abilities.
    • U.S. Citizenship and ability to obtain and maintain Public Trust clearance.
    • Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

    Nice to Have:

    • Prior experience with IHS or other federal healthcare systems (e.g., RPMS).
    • Familiarity with enterprise storage (SAN), Oracle/DB2, and AIX virtualization (LPARs/VIOS).
    • Exposure to DevOps tools (e.g., Ansible, Chef, Puppet) and cloud integration.
    • Relevant certifications (IBM AIX Admin, CompTIA Security+, ITIL Foundation).


    Additional Information

    All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
tecnologias: Python, Rust, R, Oracle, Ansible, AI, DevOps, Agile, API, Excel, Git

descripcion:
Parent Pay is seeking an experienced Software Developer to join our Parental Engagement Messaging team. This is a fully remote role.
An in person interview may be requested.

You will be working with a highly collaborative and Agile development team based both in the UK and India, to design, develop, test, and maintain software solutions for communications within the education sector, at all levels of the software stack



Key Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Build responsive code using the latest web technologies.

‚Ä¢ Develop server-side logic with ASP.NET Core.

‚Ä¢ Utilize Azure services for cloud-based applications.

‚Ä¢ Work with CI/CD pipelines within Azure DevOps.

‚Ä¢ Design and implement secure RESTful APIs.


Skills, Knowledge and Expertise
Advanced knowledge of the following technologies:

Front-end Tech:

HTML, CSS, JavaScript, TypeScript, AngularJS & Angular, NodeJS.

Back-end Tech:

C#, ASP .NET/.NET Framework/.NET Core, WebAPI / REST API, Nunit, Moq, SQL Server, Entity Framework, MS Azure (App Services, Service Bus, Notification Hub, Web Jobs, Functions), IdentityModel.

Dev Tools:

Visual Studio with ReSharper, Visual Studio Code, Azure DevOps, Git, SSMS.

Other skills:

¬∑ Excellent problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.

¬∑ Good communication skills and ability to work collaboratively in an Agile team environment.

¬∑ An understanding of software development principles and best practices.

¬∑ An understanding of secure web development practices.

¬∑ The ability to work remotely with minimal supervision in a suitable working environment.

descripcion:
Company Description

Mirantis¬†is an¬†open cloud¬†company that helps organizations achieve digital self determination by giving them complete control over their strategic infrastructure. Established in 1997, the Libertex Group is an international powerhouse with over 27 years of financial markets expertise.

Over the years, the Libertex Group has helped shape the online trading industry by merging together innovative technology, market movements and digital trends. This was made possible with the introduction of ‚ÄòLibertex‚Äô, the multi-awarded online trading platform with which anyone can access the market and invest in stocks or trade CFDs with underlying assets being commodities, Forex, ETFs, cryptocurrencies, and others.

A firm believer in the power of sports to inspire, empower and push for success, Libertex is the Official Online Trading Partner of KICK Sauber F1 Team and FC Bayern.

The Libertex Group in Numbers:

‚Ä¢ 27+ years of fintech experience
‚Ä¢ 3M+ clients worldwide
‚Ä¢ 700+ employees
‚Ä¢ 45+ international awards (for Libertex)
‚Ä¢ 300+ tradable assets (through Libertex)

The Libertex Group is constantly driven by a single passionate purpose ‚Äì to tirelessly work on developing amazing fintech for people who simply want to have ‚Äòmore‚Äô in their lives.

¬†

Job Overview¬†

We are seeking a Fullstack Developer to build scalable microservice-based applications and contribute across the entire development lifecycle, including frontend, backend, and cloud infrastructure.

Requirements

- Hands-on¬† experience in Java and Spring Boot

- Good understanding of microservice architecture principles

- Familiarity with CI/CD practices and version control (Git)

- Ability to work independently, take initiative, and drive features forward

- Solid problem-solving skills and attention to detail

- Good communication and teamwork skills

¬†

Responsibilities

- Design and develop scalable and high-performance fullstack applications using Java (Spring Boot) and JavaScript/TypeScript

- Participate in architectural design and implementation of microservice-based solutions

- Develop and maintain responsive front-end components using Vue.js (or willingness to adopt Vue with experience in other modern frameworks)

- Ensure high code quality through testing, code reviews, and adherence to best practices

- Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to deliver end-to-end features

- Debug, troubleshoot, and continuously improve existing functionality

- Contribute to infrastructure-related/automatisation¬† tasks, cloud environments together with Devops engineers.¬†

- Take ownership of features and drive them

¬†

Benefits

  • Medical Insurance Plan with coverage for the employee and their immediate family from day one

  • Yearly reimbursement of travel expenses for the employee and family's flight home
  • Corporate events and team building activities
  • Udemy Business unlimited membership & language training courses¬†
  • Professional and personal development opportunities in a fast-growing environment¬†

Libertex Group is an equal opportunity employer, fostering an inclusive and diverse environment. We do not discriminate based on any characteristic protected by the law. Candidate privacy is respected, and all data is securely stored and used solely for recruitment purposes, in line with GDPR and our internal policies. Unsuccessful applicants may have their data retained for future opportunities unless deletion is requested.

About the Job:

As a Strategic Solutions Engineer at LaunchDarkly, you are the trusted advisor to clients, tackling their key challenges with our products. You excel in active listening, prioritize customer success, and demonstrate profound technical expertise with a customer-centric focus. You bring adaptability, a thoughtful approach to managing multiple priorities, and knowledge of sales frameworks that support confident, inclusive decision-making and continuous improvement throughout the sales process.

Your ability to cultivate crucial relationships in strategic accounts is matched by your growth mindset. Embracing feedback, you collaborate effectively with your team to overcome challenges. In this role, you will contribute significantly to the growth of LaunchDarkly, helping leading global companies enhance their software development practices. Join us in empowering teams to deliver and control their software to elevate their own customers‚Äô experiences.

Responsibilities:

  • Inspire prospects with our software: Help make business decision makers, practitioners and the broader community enthusiastic champions through excellent demos and talks

  • Identify pain and design solutions: Identify LaunchDarkly prospects‚Äô largest problems and design solutions to solve them

  • Lead successful evaluations: Lead exceptional, curated evaluations of the LaunchDarkly platform

  • Ensure adoption: Partner with customers to make the LaunchDarkly adoption path clear

  • Partner with Sales: Form effective partnerships rooted in your grasp of selling frameworks

  • Be a trusted expert: Become an authority. Bring valuable insight about LaunchDarkly and its surrounding ecosystem to each conversation. Follow through on your commitments.

  • Advocate for our customers: Be the voice of the customer to our Product and Engineering teams

  • Spend time with the customer: 25-50% travel may be required to spend time in person with customers and colleagues

About You:

  • Passion for Learning and Growth: You actively seek and give feedback well. You have a growth mindset. You remain current on new technologies.

  • Motivation & Ownership: You strive for ambitious goals. You are comfortable taking initiative, and also know when to collaborate or escalate. You take pride in your work.

  • Effective Communication: You simplify complexity. You are clear, complete and concise. You tailor your message to your audience.

  • Adaptability: You excel in a fast-paced, dynamic organizational setting, taking action even when clarity is low.

  • Teamwork: You commit to great frameworks, remaining flexible within them to win as a team

  • Relationships: You consistently forge meaningful partnerships with customers and colleagues

  • Customer-focused: You actively listen to customers and take action to ensure they reach their full potential

  • Technical Expertise: You possess in-depth knowledge and hands-on experience with various developer and infrastructure technologies

Qualifications:

  • 3+ Years experience with the development processes and needs of large enterprise and strategic customers

  • Led technical trials that resulted in significant deals for your company

  • Experienced in demoing technical solutions to VP & C-Level audiences

  • Proven success in cultivating customer champions

  • Proficient in sales frameworks (MEDDPICC or similar)

  • Have led land and expand initiatives with your customers

  • 25% travel required

Pay:

Target pay ranges based on Geographic Zones* for Level¬†P4:

  • Zone 1: San Francisco/Bay Area or New York City Metropolitan Area: $210,000 - $280,000** On Target Earnings (OTE) includes base pay and commission
  • Zone 2: Boston,¬†DC, Irvine, LA, Monterey, Santa Barbara, Santa Rosa, Seattle: $190,000 - $250,000** On Target Earnings (OTE) includes base pay and commission
  • Zone 3: All other US locations: $180,000 - $235,000** On Target Earnings (OTE) includes base pay and commission

Target pay ranges based on Geographic Zones* for Level¬†P5:

  • Zone 1: San Francisco/Bay Area or New York City Metropolitan Area: $235,000 - 315,000** On Target Earnings (OTE) includes base pay and commission
  • Zone 2: Boston,¬†DC, Irvine, LA, Monterey, Santa Barbara, Santa Rosa, Seattle: $215,000 - 280,000** On Target Earnings (OTE) includes base pay and commission
  • Zone 3: All other US locations: $200,000 - 265,000** On Target Earnings (OTE) includes base pay and commission

LaunchDarkly operates from a place of high trust and transparency; we are happy to state the pay range for our open roles to best align with your needs. Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, and location.

*Within the United States, our geographic pay zones are defined by counties surrounding major metropolitan areas.

**Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), health, vision, and dental insurance, and mental health benefits in addition to salary.¬†

About LaunchDarkly:

Modern software delivery was supposed to be the foundation for a thriving digital business but reality has proven otherwise. Slow, inefficient development cycles, costly outages, and fragmented customer experiences are preventing developers from building their best software. The LaunchDarkly platform helps developers innovate on new features faster while protecting them with a safety valve to instantly rewind when things go wrong. Developers can target product experiences to any customer segment and maximize the business impact of every feature. And by gradually rolling out new application components, they escape nightmare "big-bang" technology migrations.¬†

The LaunchDarkly platform was built to guide engineers to the next frontier of DevOps by:

  • Improving the velocity and stability of software releases, without the fear of end customer outages
  • Delivering targeted experiences by easily personalizing features to customer cohorts
  • Maximizing the business impact of every feature through the ability to experiment and optimize
  • Coordinating the release and optimization of software to provide consistent experiences across mobile platforms and device types
  • Improving the effectiveness and productivity of engineering teams, by providing insights into engineering cadence and stability

At LaunchDarkly, we believe in the power of teams. We're building a team that is humble, open, collaborative, respectful and kind. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. LD invites any applicant to review our written Affirmative Action Plan. To do so, contact People Ops at hr@launchdarkly.com.¬†

Do you need a disability accommodation?

Fill out this¬†accommodations request form¬†and someone from our People Operations team will contact you for assistance.¬†

We started by building essential sales tools like aerial roof measurements and digital sales proposals. But when our customers asked for a simple, affordable way to manage and scale their entire businesses, we listened. So, we created a CRM that connects these solutions‚Äîalong with payments, material ordering, and more‚Äîinto a seamless, powerful platform. With a clear roadmap ahead, we‚Äôre excited to continue expanding and leading the market with innovative products.

We have an amazing culture, strong financials, and best-in-class company metrics. It‚Äôs an exciting time to be part of an extraordinary startup that is already successful, yet still early enough to offer its team significant growth, equity, and the opportunity to make a real impact.

What You'll Get to Do:

  • Manage endpoint device systems across MacOS and Windows platforms in a fast-paced environment
  • Support the entire user lifecycle including onboarding.
  • Support and contribute to TechOps initiatives within including SSO, Endpoint Protection and Fleet management.
  • Collaborate with the DevOps team to maintain security, scalability, and reliability of cloud infrastructure
  • Develop and maintain Python scripts to automate routine tasks
  • Assist with monitoring systems, alert management, and incident response procedures
  • Serve as the primary point of contact for user support, troubleshooting hardware and software issues for the team.
  • Contribute to documentation of IT and DevOps processes, policies, and procedures
  • Help drive the technology architecture to support Roofr's next stage of growth

What You'll Bring to the Role:

  • 5+ years of experience in IT systems administration or similar technical role
  • Strong communication skills and ability to work across the organization
  • Strong proficiency with MacOS and Windows endpoint management including packaging, patch management and remote provisioning.
  • Hands-on experience with MDM solutions, preferably Rippling
  • Experience administering GSuite including setting up SSO / SCIM integrations
  • Working knowledge of cloud infrastructure and containers
  • Proficiency in Bash, Powershell and Python scripting for automation and system integration
  • Understanding of version control systems (Git) and collaborative workflows
  • Understands the challenges and priorities of an early-stage fully remote company
  • Proven experience planning and executing the technical logistics for on-site company events, including all-hands meetings and multi-day retreats.

Bonus Points For

  • Experience with configuration management tools (Terraform, Ansible, Chef, Puppet)
  • Experience with API integrations and automation workflows

¬†

üè† What we offer:

When you join our team, you‚Äôre not just accepting a job. You‚Äôre making a career move. Here‚Äôs how we‚Äôll support you in doing some of the most impactful work of your career:

üèùÔ∏è Vacation/Paid Time Off:

  • 1st week of employment is mandatory PTO! Start your journey with Roofr by decompressing and recharging - we will see you in week 2!
  • 1 Friday off per month (we call those our laundry days!)
  • Company wide paid shutdown for the week between Christmas and New Years
  • Flexible time off
  • 80% employer paid benefits¬†

  • Generous Parental Leave policy

ü§ù Perks:

  • We host 2 retreats per year and great team building activities
  • Ample learning and development opportunities to continue growing your career

Roofr is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity in the workplace regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or veteran status.

IMPORTANT NOTICE: Our company takes the security and privacy of job applicants very seriously. We will never ask for payment, bank details, or personal financial information as part of the application process. descripcion:
CloudQuery is seeking a talented and experienced Staff Security Engineer to join our core team. You will be responsible for shaping our security strategy and ensuring our infrastructure and operations adhere to industry standards. This is a high-impact, hands-on role where you'll lead the charge on maintaining our SOC2 attestation and oversee risk management efforts to ensure CloudQuery is secure, compliant, and efficient.

¬†

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with engineering, product, and executive teams to design and implement security initiatives.
  • Lead end-to-end efforts to achieve SOC2 attestation and other relevant certifications.
  • Manage MDM (Mobile Device Management) and other security software to enforce company-wide security policies.
  • Oversee the implementation of security tools and practices across all departments, including DevOps, engineering, and corporate systems.
  • Develop and maintain security policies, standards, and procedures that meet compliance requirements and best practices.
  • Conduct regular risk assessments, audits, and reviews to identify and mitigate potential security threats.
  • Drive security awareness and training initiatives to ensure all team members understand security best practices.
  • Stay up to date with emerging security trends and technologies to continuously improve the security posture of CloudQuery.
  • Lead incident response planning, simulation, and real-time handling of security incidents.
  • Prepare and maintain thorough documentation for security measures, processes, and risk management activities.

¬†

Requirements

  • 6+ years of experience in IT security, with a strong track record in managing security risk.
  • Experience leading SOC2 and similar certification processes, with hands-on experience in compliance, audits, and security frameworks.
  • Solid understanding of MDM solutions, endpoint security, and IT management.
  • Strong familiarity with cloud platforms, security best practices, and DevOps processes.
  • Experience in security incident management, threat detection, and vulnerability assessments.
  • Excellent communicator with the ability to clearly document security processes and present them to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Self-driven, resourceful, and able to thrive in a remote-first environment.
  • A passion for security, automation, and ensuring development velocity without compromising on safety.

Benefits

  • Remote-first company!
  • Competitive pay with significant options pack upside.
  • Remote-friendly environment and culture that nurtures company and team events to stay connected.
  • High-impact role with lots of responsibilities and opportunities for career advancement



About the company


CloudQuery is a developer-first cloud governance platform that consists of three main components that can be used together or stand alone. Data Pipelines, Cloud Asset Inventory and CSPM (Cloud Security Posture Management).
tecnologias: Go, R, AI, DevOps, API, Excel

descripcion:
We‚Äôre looking for a senior Site Reliability Engineer to join our growing team and help us build robust, scalable systems that support our mission in the renewable energy space. You‚Äôll take ownership of key infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines, and work on projects that improve reliability, performance, and developer experience across the company.


Rather than looking for someone who just ticks boxes, we want someone who understands systems deeply, cares about code quality, and can write clean, maintainable automation code. If you‚Äôve got a strong foundation in DevOps principles, experience with cloud infrastructure and databases, and enjoy enabling teams to move faster and safer, we‚Äôd love to meet you.


This role is fully remote.


What You Will Do


  • Lead and nurture our SRE team and help create a modern SRE culture
  • Create, maintain and update our infrastructure-as-code stack and pipelines
  • Optimize and enhance our incindent response and disaster recovery processes
  • Fine-tune, expand and automate our observability stack and ensure SLOs and SLAs meet the required standards
  • Rightsize, optimize and maintain our infrastructure with special regards to kubernetes, databases and queues
  • Organize and lead cross-cloud migration efforts for hundreds of servers


About You


  • Smart and gets things done
  • You have years of experience as a Senior Site Reliability Engineer with a strong portfolio of completed projects
  • You know how to diagnose and maintain databases and queues for optimal performance at a minimum price
  • You master kubernetes clusters
  • CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices are your thing and you despise clickOps with a passion
  • You have a 4-hour overlap with CET/CEST time zones as our teams are globally distributed
  • You‚Äôre can travel to Italy within three months of hiring, and can get a visa to do so if needed


Why Join Us


  • We are a remote-first company and this is a fully remote position
  • We build amazing teams with brilliant, happy, and motivated individuals
  • Earn Euro-level salaries with over 30 days of vacation, sick pay, and other benefits
  • The role is a permanent full-time position. We invest in people and understand great things happen if we do
  • Be part of our amazing company trajectory over the next five years
  • Travel to Sicily, Italy once a year for a fully paid company retreat


We support and encourage diversity in our workplace. Applications are welcome from all backgrounds without regard to race, ethnicity, gender, orientation, age, or religion. Please apply even if you don't meet all the criteria listed.
tecnologias: Go, Scala, R, Kubernetes, AI, DevOps, CI/CD, API, SPA

descripcion:
Position Name: DevOps Engineer with AWS Skills
Reports to: Professional Services Director
Location/Type:¬†UA Remote

About Us:
Atlas Technica's mission is to shoulder IT management, user support, and cybersecurity for our clients, who are hedge funds and other investment firms. Founded in 2016, we have grown 100% year over year through our uncompromising focus on service.

We value ownership, execution, growth, intelligence, and camaraderie. We are looking for people who share our Core Values, thrive, and contribute to this environment while putting the customer first. At Atlas Technica, we offer a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and great perks to our global Team. We strive to maintain a professional yet friendly environment while promoting professional and career development for our Team Members. Join Atlas Technica now!

We are seeking an individual with experience in AWS to join our Service team. The goal of this team is to design, implement and support public cloud solutions for our customers.

Responsibilities

  • Design, deploy, and maintain AWS infrastructure using best practices, with a focus on reliability, scalability, and security.
  • Automate infrastructure provisioning, configuration, and deployment processes using Terraform and Ansible
  • Implement a Kubernetes-based platform and migrate existing workloads to it.
  • Implement organization-wide logging, monitoring, and security solutions in a multi-account and multi-region AWS organization.
  • Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines to automate the software delivery process.
  • Monitor and troubleshoot AWS infrastructure to ensure high availability and performance.
  • Implement and enforce security best practices, including IAM policies, encryption, and network security controls.
  • Perform regular backups, disaster recovery planning, and system upgrades.
  • Stay current with AWS services and industry best practices to continuously improve our infrastructure and processes.
  • Provide technical guidance and support to junior team members and stakeholders on AWS-related matters.
  • Participate in on-call rotation and respond to incidents as needed.

    Qualifications

    • Proven experience designing, deploying, and managing AWS infrastructure in production environments (EC2, S3, RDS, VPC, and IAM roles).
    • Strong proficiency in infrastructure as code (IaC) automation (Terraform, Atmos, Terragrunt, etc.)
    • Strong understanding of networking concepts, including VPC, subnetting, routing, and security groups.
    • Experience with AWS Organizations, IAM Identity Center and Control Tower managing multiple accounts.
    • Experience with automation scripts (Python, Groovy, or Bash).
    • Experience with monitoring and logging tools such as CloudWatch, Prometheus, or Grafana.
    • Experience working with development, operations, and security teams to integrate AWS solutions into existing workflows and processes.
    • Ability to communicate complex technical information to different audiences.
    • AWS certifications such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect, AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, or AWS Certified SysOps Administrator.

        Preferred Qualifications

        • Extensive experience working with Kubernetes (EKS), Docker, Helm.
        • Familiarity with infrastructure monitoring and management tools like Terraform Enterprise, AWS Systems Manager, or HashiCorp Vault.
        • Experience with other cloud platforms such as Azure or Google Cloud Platform would be a plus.
        • Experience working with clients in finance or alternative investment industries would be a plus.
        • Experience working at a Managed Services Provider would be a plus.

        Atlas Technica is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.¬†
tecnologias: Python, Go, Scala, R, AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, Ansible, AI, DevOps, CI/CD, API

descripcion:
Black Duck Software, Inc. helps organizations build secure, high-quality software, minimizing risks while maximizing speed and productivity. Black Duck, a recognized pioneer in application security, provides SAST, SCA, and DAST solutions that enable teams to quickly find and fix vulnerabilities and defects in proprietary code, open source components, and application behavior. With a combination of industry-leading tools, services, and expertise, only Black Duck helps organizations maximize security and quality in DevSecOps and throughout the software development life cycle.

We are seeking a motivated senior Sales Engineer to join our Commercial Sales team on the East Coast. The ideal candidate will bridge the technical and commercial aspects of our security solutions, working closely with both customers and the sales team to demonstrate the value of our application security testing portfolio.¬†¬†

Key Responsibilities:¬†

  • Partner with account teams to develop and execute technical sales strategies for application security testing solutions¬†¬†
  • Lead technical discovery sessions, demonstrations, and proof of concept implementations for prospects and customers¬†¬†
  • Provide technical consultation on static application security testing (SAST), software composition analysis (SCA), and dynamic application security testing (DAST) solutions¬†¬†
  • Analyze customer environments and requirements to design and propose security solutions¬†¬†
  • Create and deliver compelling technical presentations and documentation tailored to various technical and business stakeholders¬†¬†
  • Support security architecture discussions and integrate with customer DevSecOps workflows¬†¬†
  • Provide competitive technical differentiation and value proposition¬†
  • Participate in application security industry events and stay current with emerging technologies and trends¬†

Required Qualifications:¬†

  • 5+ years of experience in application security sales engineering, solution architecture, or related technical pre-sales role ¬†
  • Understanding of application security concepts, vulnerabilities, and testing methodologies¬†¬†
  • Experience in SAST, SCA, or DAST technologies¬†
  • Technical skill-set in software development, security engineering, or related field¬†¬†
  • Excellent problem-solving abilities and innovative thinking approach¬†¬†
  • Outstanding communication skills with ability to articulate complex technical concepts to various audiences¬†¬†

Preferred Qualifications:¬†

  • Prior consulting or solutions engineering experience¬†¬†
  • Exposure to DevOps tools and methodologies¬†¬†
  • Understanding of CI/CD pipelines¬†
  • Technical aptitude: Understanding of general development techniques, tools and features of various languages (Java/ C/ C++/ .Net/ Ruby/ scripting...), though coding is not a primary job function¬†¬†
  • Solution orientation: Creative problem-solving and consultative selling¬†¬†
  • Communication: Excellent verbal and written skills for engaging with technical and business stakeholders¬†¬†
  • Project management: Ability to manage multiple concurrent customer engagements¬†¬†
  • Adaptability: Flexible thinking and ability to adjust approach based on customer needs¬†¬†

The ideal candidate will combine technical expertise with strong business acumen, demonstrating the ability to understand customer challenges. They should be passionate about application security and motivated to help organizations improve their security posture through innovative solutions.¬†

Pay Range
$100,000‚Äî$150,000 USD

Black Duck considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender preference, national origin, age, disability, or status as a Covered Veteran in accordance with federal law. In addition, Black Duck complies with applicable state and local laws prohibiting discrimination in employment in every jurisdiction in which it maintains facilities. Black Duck also provides reasonable accommodation to individuals with a disability in accordance with applicable laws.
tecnologias: Java, C++, Ruby, R, AWS, AI, DevOps, CI/CD, API, SPA, Excel

descripcion:
This role is for our mother company, XTM.

XTM International, a global leader in localization technology, has acquired Transifex, an innovative SaaS-based Localization & Translation Management Platform. Transifex provides the required connectivity and advanced AI capabilities to help customers easily and continuously translate digital content on platforms such as SaaS, software, and websites, as well as mobile apps, games, videos, and much more.

XTM International is a leading provider of translation management software (TMS). The company's cloud-based platform helps businesses streamline their translation processes and improve efficiency.

We are looking for a strategic and hands-on Director of Cloud Operations to lead our infrastructure and DevOps initiatives across a global SaaS platform. This is a critical leadership role that ensures the scalability, reliability, and security of our systems while driving innovation in cloud operations.

In this role, you will:

  • Lead, mentor, and grow high-performing DevOps and system administration teams.
  • Own the end-to-end DevOps strategy across XTM‚Äôs product suite, including CI/CD, infrastructure as code, observability, and release management.
  • Oversee operations across multiple cloud and hosting environments, ensuring consistent performance and availability.
  • Collaborate with Engineering to evolve and transform our operations to the next level of reliability and scalability.
  • Drive the adoption of best practices in security, automation, monitoring, and incident response.
  • Champion cost optimization, capacity planning, and future scalability.
  • Ensure compliance with data protection regulations, security standards, and industry best practices.
  • Lead incident response and postmortem processes, ensuring continuous learning and improvement.
  • Define and track KPIs for infrastructure reliability and other key metrics.
  • Manage vendor relationships, including cloud providers and DevOps tooling platforms.
  • You will be responsible for helping improve Reliability, Scalability, Security, and Operations of our SaaS platform.

Well-versed in cloud tools, concepts, and methodologies.

Requirements

To succeed in this position, you should bring a mix of technical expertise, leadership experience, and a passion for building resilient systems. We‚Äôre looking for someone who thrives in dynamic environments and can align infrastructure strategy with broader business goals.

  • Bachelor's degree (or equivalent) in computer science or related field, or equivalent experience required.
  • Fluency in English.
  • Experience leading teams supporting AWS and/or Google Cloud Platform.
  • Architectural experience building and managing large scale cloud platforms.
  • Strong expertise in AWS, Kubernetes, Terraform, Docker, CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab CI).
  • Solid understanding of modern DevOps practices, site reliability engineering (SRE), and infrastructure as code (IaC).
  • Experience managing hybrid hosting environments, including cloud, on-premise, and private cloud.
  • Excellent cross-functional leadership skills.
  • Strategic thinker with hands-on technical skills.
  • Excellent client facing skills being an effective communicator with high quality presentation skills as well as verbal and written communication skills.
  • Positive and enthusiastic with a high level of cross-functional partnership across other technical teams and XTM as a whole.
  • Possess a problem-solving attitude and are adaptable in the face of change.
  • Resilient in the face of challenges, change, and ambiguity.
  • Optimistic and believe that you can make a problem into a solution.
  • Familiarity with ISO 27001, SOC 2, GDPR, and other regulatory frameworks is a plus.

Benefits

The health of our company and the success of the SaaS product we offer is directly related to the work environment we create for ourselves. With this in mind, we strive to create a welcoming and positive place in which we work and thrive! For the first time, Transifex has been recognized as a ‚ÄúBest Workplace for Women Hellas‚Äù! And we are proud to be recognized as a 2024 Best Workplace and Best in Tech companies with fewer than 50 employees in Greece, creating an outstanding experience for our people. For our team members, we offer:

  • Private Health & Dental Insurance Plan
  • Life and AD&D Insurance
  • Ticket Restaurant Card (GR)
  • Fully Remote & Flexible Work Environment
  • Paid Time Off & Holidays
  • Paid Sabbatical Leave and other types of leave
  • Learning Opportunities
  • Cool co-working space with amenities & parking (GR)
  • Top notch equipment of your choice
  • Equipment allowance to set up your home office
  • Monthly remote-work stipend
  • Company Fun Events
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Calm Meditation App Subscription
  • Yoga sessions
  • Amazing culture and close-knit team


About the company

Transifex, an XTM International company, is a SaaS continuous localization platform powering the process of launching products into multiple languages for companies with rapid development cycles. To date, Transifex has simplified the localization process for over 20,000 software projects & 200,000+ users under the Transifex umbrella with customers including Eventbrite, Hubspot, Waze, Datadog, Vodafone, and more.
